meanings.definition: A toxin that has been treated to destroy its toxic properties but retains its ability to stimulate the production of antibodies.
meanings.sent1: The toxoid helped the body make antibodies.
meanings.sent2: Doctors used a toxoid to trigger the immune response.
meanings.sent3: The toxoid walked into the immune system's party and got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent4: The toxoid was like a harmless spy, tricking the body into preparing for battle.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the toxoid as a friendly invader, training the immune system to fight.
